adjective.description: (chiefly of a drug or medicine) tending to stimulate or facilitate evacuation of the bowels.
examples: the laxative properties of sodium sulfate

noun.description: A medicine which has a laxative effect.
examples: he may prescribe a laxative to ease the congestion

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French laxatif, -ive or late Latin laxativus, from Latin laxare loosen (from laxus loose).
